trans-unit.source: Step 5: Create and Configure the LOB Target
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Create and Configure the LOB Target

trans-unit.source: In order to connect to an on-premise LOB application, create <token>lobrelay</token>s and <token>lobtarget</token>s as part of your <token>af_integration</token> application.
trans-unit.target: In order to connect to an on-premise LOB application, create <token>lobrelay</token>s and <token>lobtarget</token>s as part of your <token>af_integration</token> application.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how <token>lobrelay</token>s and <token>lobtarget</token>s manage connectivity with an on-premise LOB application, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Bus Connect Architecture</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=249156</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on how <token>lobrelay</token>s and <token>lobtarget</token>s manage connectivity with an on-premise LOB application, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Bus Connect Architecture</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=249156</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instruction on how to create a SQL Server table where the data for insurance claims is inserted, how to create an <token>lobrelay</token> and an <token>lobtarget</token> for the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the SQL Server table, and then how to generate the schema for the Insert operation on the SQL Server table.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instruction on how to create a SQL Server table where the data for insurance claims is inserted, how to create an <token>lobrelay</token> and an <token>lobtarget</token> for the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the SQL Server table, and then how to generate the schema for the Insert operation on the SQL Server table.
